title: Seasonality drives leaf solute potential independently from drought in grapevines. A commentary on ‘Grape cultivars adapted to hotter, drier growing regions exhibit greater photosynthesis in hot conditions despite less drought-resistant leaves’
content: This article comments on:Gabriela Sinclair, Erin R. Galarneau, Josh F. Hnizdor, Andrew J. McElrone, Michael Andrew Walker and Megan K. Bartlett, Grape cultivars adapted to hotter, drier growing regions exhibit greater photosynthesis in hot conditions despite less drought-resistant leaves, Annals of Botany, Volume 134, Issue 2, 1 August 2024, Pages 205–217 https://doi.org/10.1093/aob/mcae032
